intro: Hibbertia perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate guinea flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are often hairy. Hibbertia perfoliata is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
